page.title: 02Population of Crathie
page.content: There is no village as such at Crathie. Most of the community live and work on the Royal Estate or on small holdings up in the hills. In total there are 136 adults and 52 children. There are a few homes alongside the Church and next to the school. The former free church is used for a church hall. There is a bus service which runs between Braemar and Ballater and Aberdeen. Many families find it a necessity to own their own transport. Employment in Aberdeen makes commuting essential for some. There are several families who have lived in the area for a long time. The farms in the hills are run on traditional lines with all work being done by members of the family. The children go on to secondary education at Aboyne, about 17 miles away.
